thread.title: USC's Gustin, Masina happy to come out on top against their Utah brothers
thread.title_full: USC's Gustin, Masina happy to come out on top against their Utah brothers | Deseret News

author: Mike Sorensen
title: USC's Gustin, Masina happy to come out on top against their Utah brothers
text:
Both Porter Gustin and Osa Masina, who played high school ball in Utah, were on the field for USC in its victory over Utah Saturday night at the L.A. Coliseum.
Scoreboard USC UTAH 0 0 Full box score/Player stats Upcoming Games Utah Football Utah football stats & schedule Ore. St. @ Utah Rice-Eccles Stadium, Salt Lake City Oct. 31, 5:00 p.m. 6 Days 7 Hrs 29 Mins 38 Secs More Coverage Sunday Morning QB: Stars and stats from No. 3 Utah's 42-24 upset loss at USC Utes' goals still intact, but they fail to make correction Utah's unbeaten season crumbles in L.A. as USC overpowers third-ranked Utes 42-24 Utah notebook: Hil makes it clear about wanting Whittingham to stay with the Utes “ For sure I’ve got a lot of Utah fans talking trash to me all week and I’m going to go hit them up after this.”
Porter Gustin
LOS ANGELES — A year ago, they were both playing high school football in Utah — Porter Gustin for Salem Hills and Osa Masina for Brighton.
On Saturday in the famed L.A. Coliseum, both Utah prepsters were playing for the USC Trojans against their home state school.
Neither started the game, but both played substantial minutes for the Trojans in their decisive 42-24 victory over the Utes and were thrilled to come away as victors.
“For sure I’ve got a lot of Utah fans talking trash to me all week and I’m going to go hit them up after this,’’ said Gustin after the game. “It’s nice, that loss to Notre Dame really fired us up so we had a good week of practice and we came out physical.’’
For Masina, the win was special because it gave him family bragging rights since his older brother, Uaea, is a backup linebacker for the Utes, who played substantial minutes and came up with four tackles.
“We didn’t get to go head to head, but it was definitely an experience, seeing him on the field, not playing with him, but against him,’’ said Osa. “It was fun. The main thing tonight was getting a W.’’
Coming into the game, Masina ranked sixth on the team in tackles, with a fumble recovery for a touchdown in the first game against Arkansas State. Gustin had 13 tackles including three for loss with two sacks.
Both players were on the field for the Trojans at the start of the second quarter, Gustin at outside linebacker and Masina at inside linebacker. Both were credited with one tackle in the game.
As for his decision to come to USC instead of Utah, Osa Masina said, “I love it here, wouldn’t trade it for anything.’’
